meanings.definition: The action of digging or hollowing out an area.
meanings.sent1: The excavation in the backyard revealed ancient artifacts buried underground.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers began the excavation to build the foundation for the new house.
meanings.sent3: The kids turned the sandbox into an excavation site, pretending to be archaeologists.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was an excavation of memories, each one carefully unearthed and examined.
meanings.sent5: The excavation of the old mine was a daunting task, but the miners were determined to uncover its secrets.

meanings.definition: A site where archaeological digging is taking place.
meanings.sent1: The excavation at the ancient ruins attracted many tourists eager to see the discoveries.
meanings.sent2: The excavation was carefully marked off to prevent any disturbances to the artifacts.
meanings.sent3: The excavation turned into a popular spot for school field trips, with kids learning about history firsthand.
meanings.sent4: The excavation site was a treasure trove of clues about the past, waiting to be deciphered.
meanings.sent5: The excavation area buzzed with excitement as the archaeologists uncovered a rare find.
